question: Why was the old bamboo wood-cutter sad?
answer1: no child had Heaven sent
answer4: For no child had Heaven sent to cheer his old age

question: Why was there no hope of rest from work till the wood-cutter died?
answer1: He was very poor.
answer4: He needed to cut bamboo to make a living
answer5: He and his wife lived off of the bamboo they sold

question: What did the wood-cutter do every morning?
answer1: went forth into the woods and hills
answer2: cut down these feathers of the forest
answer3: carry the bamboo wood home and make it into various articles
answer4: Every morning he went forth into the woods and hills wherever the bamboo reared its lithe green plumes against the sky

question: How did the wood-cutter and his wife gain a small livelihood?
answer1: selling the things he made out of bamboo
answer2: selling the household items he made out of bamboo
answer4: By making the bamboo into various house hold items

question: What was different about this trip to the woods?
answer1: There was a bright soft light in the woods.
answer2: He found a tiny human being in the woods.
answer4: The green grove of bamboos was flooded with a bright soft light, as if the full moon had risen over the spot

question: How did the wood-cutter feel when he saw the light in the woods?
answer1: astonishment
answer4: Astonishment

question: Where did the light come from?
answer1: hollow in the green bamboo stem
answer4: One bamboo

question: Who was standing in the middle of the bamboo stem?
answer1: a tiny human being
answer4: A tiny human being

question: What was special about the tiny human being?
answer1: three inches in height
answer2: exquisitely beautiful
answer4: It was being, only three inches in height, and exquisitely beautiful in appearance

question: Why did the old man think the tiny human being was sent to be his child?
answer1: He found him here among the bamboos where lies his daily work.
answer4: for he find her here among the bamboos where lies his daily work

question: How will the old man and his wife feel about the tiny human being?
answer1: happy
answer2: excited
answer4: Happy

question: What happened because the tiny girl was so small?
answer1: The old woman put her into a basket.
answer4: The old woman put her into a basket to safeguard her from the least possibility of being hurt in any way

question: How did the old couple expend all the love in their old age?
answer1: loving the tiny girl
answer2: taking in the girl to be their child
answer4: With joy

question: How did the old man become rich?
answer1: He found precious stones and gold in bamboo.
answer2: He sold the gold and precious stones he found in the bamboo.
answer4: The old man often found gold in the notches of the bamboos when he hewed them down and cut them up; not only gold, but precious stones also

question: What did the old man do with his new wealth?
answer1: built himself a fine house
answer4: He built himself a fine house

question: What happened in three months?
answer1: The bamboo child had become a full-grown girl.
answer4: The bamboo child had become a full-grown girl

question: Why did the parents wait upon the girl themselves?
answer1: She was of such wondrous beauty.
answer2: They allowed no one to see her.
answer4: She was of such wondrous beauty that they placed her behind the screens like a princess, and allowed no one to see her

question: How did the girl's presence influence those around her?
answer1: She made people feel happy.
answer2: She made them forget their sorrow.
answer4: The house was filled with a soft shining
answer5: Whenever the old man felt sad, he had only to look upon his foster-daughter and his sorrow vanished

question: Why was the girl named Princess Moonlight?
answer1: Her body gave forth so much soft bright light that she might have been a daughter of the Moon God.
answer4: Her body gave forth so much soft bright light that she might have been a daughter of the Moon God.

question: What was the old couple celebrating?
answer1: the naming of Princess Moonlight
answer4: The naming of their new-found child

question: What happened because the fame of the Princess's loveliness spreaded far and wide?
answer1: many were the suitors who desired to win her hand or even so much to see her
answer4: Many were the suitors who desired to win her hand

question: Why were the suitors unable to see the Princess?
answer1: Her parents kept her hidden away.
answer2: Her parents did not want anyone to see her.
answer4: Princess moonglight was kept away from other

question: Why did the suitors want to catch a glimpse of the Princess?
answer1: They wanted to see her beauty.
answer2: They wanted to win her hand.
answer4: They wanted to see her beauty

question: What made the five knights' ardor and determination grow?
answer1: obstacles
answer4: Obstacles

question: What did the five knights write to the Princess?
answer1: letters
answer2: poems

question: Why could the old man not insist on her obeying him against her wishes?
answer1: He was not her real father.
answer4: He was not her real Father

question: What happened because the old man felt sorry for the faithful suitors?
answer1: He lent a willing ear to their tale of love.
answer4: The old man lent a willing ear to their tale of love

question: How did the Princess feel upon hearing her father's request?
answer1: distress
answer4: Honored

question: Why did the Princess feel distress?

answer4: She has no wish to marry now

question: What did the Princess not feel sure about?

answer4: That she was not as beautiful as perhaps report made her out to be

question: What was the Princess afraid would happen if she married one of them?
answer1: His heart might change afterwards.
answer4: If she consented to marry any one of them, not really knowing her before, his heart might change afterwards

question: Why did the Princess demand another trial of her suitor's love?
answer1: She wanted proof of their devotion.
answer2: She wanted to make sure they loved her.
answer4: To test their love for her

question: How did the suitors feel about the Princess' message?
answer1: excited
answer2: happy
answer4: The five all accepted the trial, and thought it an excellent plan, for it would prevent jealousy between them

question: What did the Princess request from the First Knight?
answer1: the stone bowl which had belonged to Buddha
answer4: The stone bowl which had belonged to Buddha in India

question: Why did the suitors return to their own homes in despair?
answer1: They were disheartened and disgusted at what seemed to them the impossibility of the tasks given to them.

question: What happened because the suitors' love in their hearts revived her?

answer4: They resolved to make an attempt to get what she desired of them

question: Why did the First Knight not have courage to go all the way to India?
answer1: traveling was very difficult and full of danger.
answer4: In those days traveling was very dificult and fulll of danger

question: Why did the First Knight take a stone bowl from Kyoto?
answer1: He was too afraid to travel to India.

answer3: He wanted to pretend the bowl from Kyoto was from India.
answer4: He wanted to trick Princess moonlight
answer5: He did not want to go to India for the stone bowl

question: How did Princess Moonlight know the bowl was a sham?
answer1: It did not shine at all.
answer4: It did not shine at all

question: Why did the Second Knight not go to Mount Horai?
answer1: Mount Horai belonged to the land of fable and not fact.
answer4: Mount Horai belonged to the land of fable and not to fact

question: What did the Second Knight do after the branch was finished?
answer1: took his journey home and tried to make himself look as if he were wearied and worn out with travel
answer4: He took his journey home and tried to make himself look as if he were wearied and worn out with travel

question: Why did the Princess remain silent and look sad?
answer1: She knew the Second Knight was lying.
answer2: She knew that the Second Knight did not really get the branch from Mount Horai.

question: How was the Knight's deception found out?
answer1: The six jewelers sent in a petition to the Princess to be paid for their labor.
answer4: The 6 jewelers arrived to ask for payment
answer5: The 6 jewelers confessed to making the branch

question: How did the Second Knight feel towards the jewelers?
answer1: anger
answer2: rage
answer4: Rage

question: How did the Third Knight plan to get the skin of the fire-rat?
answer1: He paid his friend in China to get it for him.
answer2: He used his friend in China to have it shipped to him.
answer4: He promised his friend any amount of money he liked to ask if only he could get him the desired article

question: How did the Third Knight fail?
answer1: His friend did not get him the real fire-rat.
answer2: His friend tricked him with a fake fire-rat skin.
answer4: The fire-rat skin burned quickly
answer5: If the fire-rat skin was real, it would not catch fire but it did

question: Why did the retainers and servants have no intention of obeying the order?
answer1: They considered it impossible.

answer4: It was an impossible order

question: What did the Fourth Knight do because he was sure of winning her?

answer4: He repaired and fitted up his house to receive the Princess

question: What did the governor do when he heard of the Fourth Knight's plight?

answer4: Sent messengers with a letter inviting him to his house

question: Why did the Emperor want to see if she were really lovely as report said?

question: What would Princess Moonlight do if she were forced to go to the Palace?

answer1: She did not want to be seen.

question: What did the Emperor promise to do if she would resume her former shape?
answer1: leave her free

question: Who could the Princess not marry?
answer1: any one on this earth
answer4: She could never marry any one on this earth

question: What would happen on the fifteenth day of that very month?
answer1: Her friends from the moon would come fetch her and she would have to return.
answer4: Her friends from the moon would come to fetch her

question: What made the Princess sad?
answer1: to think of leaving her kind foster-parents and the home where she had been happy for so long
answer4: To think of leaving her kind foster-parents, and the home where she had been happy for so long

question: Why did the old man age greatly and look much more than seventy?
answer1: He was sad his daughter was leaving.

question: What did the old man plan to do?
answer1: make prisoners of the envoys from the moon

answer4: To make prisoners of the envoys from the moon, and to do all he could to prevent the Princess from being carried back

question: Why did the Princess say these measures would be useless?
answer1: nothing could prevent them from carrying out their purpose
answer4: When her people came for her nothing whatever could prevent them from carrying out their purpose

question: Who put the gold in the bamboo?
